thread.title: Things to know for Monday in Pennsylvania
thread.title_full: Things to know for Monday in Pennsylvania

author: The Associated Press
title: Things to know for Monday in Pennsylvania
text:
Things to know for Monday in Pennsylvania By The Associated Press   
FROST IN THE PUMPKIN 
For the second night in a row, temperatures around the state dropped below freezing. A freeze warning is in effect throughout the state until 9 Monday morning. Parts of northwestern Pennsylvania also reported snow, including Erie and Edinboro. 
___ 
POLICE WAITING TO SEE IF SHOPPING CENTER SHOOTING SUSPECT WELL ENOUGH TO BE ARRAIGNED 
Police say Scott Lee Sargent, 31, of Shenandoah, fired a semi-automatic rifle at officers in the parking lot of a northeastern Pennsylvania shopping center on Saturday. The suspect didn’t wound anyone, but he was shot in the abdomen and thigh and remains hospitalized. 
___ 
FIRE HEAVILY DAMAGES CENTRAL PENNSYLVANIA CHEESE PLANT 
Plant officials say workers had left about three hours before the Sun-Re Cheese Corp. operation in Sunbury caught fire Sunday morning. A fire marshal is expected to inspect the ruins Tuesday to try to figure out what happened. Nobody was hurt. 
___ 
FORGET SNAKES ON A PLANE; THIS ONE WAS ON A BUS 
Philadelphia transit authority officials say a person carrying a boa constrictor got on board the Southeastern Pennsylvania Transportation Authority bus just before 3 p.m. Sunday. The bus had to be evacuated after the snake somehow got loose and coiled itself under a seat. Police haven’t decided whether charges will be filed. 
___ 
PHILADELPHIA EAGLES PLAY HOST TO ARCHRIVAL NEW YORK GIANTS 
Are you ready for some football? The 2-3 Eagles are hoping to continue efforts to turn around their season against the Giants, who are 3-2 entering Monday night’s game at Lincoln Financial Field. 
___
